page.title: 13POLITICS IN GLOUCESTERSHIRE
page.content: {Election night} ia a subtle blend of relief and tension-the weeks of campaigning are over but the waiting for the result means anxiety. At the count all those inside are sworn to secrecy,unable to communicate with the world outside until the count is over.Unless the result is very close there will be no recount and the victor's smile normally alerts those present to the outcome.This will be around midnight as in this years local election but the count can go on much longer in a parliamentary campaign. After this {local election},however,the candidates can go home to celebrate,be consoled,or even to wonder if it was all worthwhile. In a typical class of 14 year olds only 1 person out of 25 knew the name of their {local councillor}.
